column4: hey guys, i just installed mysql, i want to make sure it's not running, hwo can i?
try tab completing the service name
but when i go to install it again, it won't work
it's not in there, they sent me to ubuntu actually :-).
i think this is basically an package manager thing.  when i go to install it, it will hang on setting up mysql-server until i hit "stop mysql" ,implying that it's running, although i don't see it.
you can see what's happening with:  ps -ef | grep mysql | grep -v grep
shows the processes but will not show the grep running :)
Rallias, agc93, ok, so now i know that it's not running, at least anyway we can see, so now i want to install it
Rallias, agc93, maybe i should first check that the package isn't installed?
Rallias, agc93, but i'm pretty sure i have all the mysql stuff really uninstalled, it doesn't show in syanptic
Rallias, agc93, yeah it doesn't show in apt, or synampitc, and its not running as a process or as a service, so i' m going to install and it won't work

Rallias, agc93, so it to setting up mysql-server and it hangs.... and then says: Unable to set password for the MySQL "root" user                                                                     â”‚
